level.text: Each child-placing agency shall have a personnel file on each employee, which shall include, but not be limited to, the following:
The application for employment or resume;
At least three (3) letters of reference;
Annual performance evaluations signed by both the employee and supervisor;
Documentation of participation in in-service training;
Signed statement by employee that written personnel policies were reviewed;
Criminal record (other than minor traffic violations);
Letter of resignation or reason for termination, upon termination of employment with the agency; and
Each child-placing agency shall have written procedures to safeguard the confidentiality of the personnel records.
Each child-placing agency shall maintain the personnel records of any employee who leaves the agency for a period of five (5) years.
